summary: The Medical Supply Sanctions Act of 2025 aims to prohibit the export of drugs and prosthetics to the Russian Federation. This prohibition, mandated by the President, covers any drug approved under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or the Public Health Service Act, and any FDA-authorized prosthetic, along with their components. The Act includes a sunset clause, terminating the prohibition once the Secretary of State certifies that Russia has ceased military operations and withdrawn its forces from Ukraine.
